quotes.text: In the old world, a process like this takes days... even weeks. It's slow, it's expensive, and it's complicated.
quotes.speaker: AI Creative Director
quotes.context: Discussing traditional briefing/storyboard process vs. AI solution

quotes.text: Go from a simple brief to a stunning, original commercial concept in minutes. No meetings. No months of waiting. Just pure, creative power.
quotes.speaker: AI Creative Director
quotes.context: Describing the AI platform's speed advantage

quotes.text: Go from idea to a full storyboard & script in minutes with our AI Briefing Engine.
quotes.speaker: AI Creative Director
quotes.context: LinkedIn ad copy describing product capability

evidence_mapping.confidence_rationale: Multiple references to 'days' and 'weeks' for traditional process, and 'minutes' for AI solution. Specific '2-3 days' appears to be analyst interpretation of 'days' mentions.

quotes.text: For too long, world-class video production has been reserved for brands with massive budgets and months to spare. The creative process was slow, complex, and expensive.
quotes.speaker: AI Creative Director
quotes.context: LinkedIn ad copy contrasting traditional vs AI production

quotes.text: This 90-second spot was produced through our hybrid 'AI + Expert Studio' model, going from a simple brief to this final master in a fraction of the time of a traditional production.
quotes.speaker: AI Creative Director
quotes.context: LinkedIn organic post describing production speed

quotes.text: You think you need a massive budget... a huge production crew... and months of meetings just to get started.
quotes.speaker: AI Creative Director

evidence_mapping.confidence_rationale: Qualitative evidence of significant speed advantage ('fraction of the time', 'months' vs implied days/weeks), but specific '10x' multiplier not stated. Analyst-calculated from qualitative descriptions.

key_findings: Only 4 metrics have any transcript evidence, all requiring inference from qualitative statements
The single VALIDATED industry stat (76% ad skip rate) is about viewer behavior, not the product
Most specific numbers (percentages, dollar amounts, ratings) appear to be analyst estimates
Time comparisons are well-supported qualitatively but lack specific quantification in transcript
Cost savings discussed but never quantified with percentages or dollar amounts
No product performance data (uptime, render times, conversion rates) found in transcript
No customer satisfaction metrics (ratings, NPS, retention) found in transcript
summary.validation_recommendation: Phase 3 should focus on obtaining product analytics data, customer survey results, and industry benchmark citations to validate the 35 STRATEGIC metrics that have no transcript evidence.
high_risk_claims: metric-015: $8,000-13,000 savings (specific dollar range with no source)
metric-016: 95% client satisfaction (very high percentage, needs survey data)
metric-017: 4.8/5 star rating (specific rating, needs review data)
metric-023: 8.5% landing page conversion (above industry average, needs analytics)
metric-033: NPS 72 (specific score, needs survey methodology)
